sentences: Ma nutan kuna ma olen kurvasti.
context: The word 'nuta' in Estonian is the basic form of the verb meaning 'to cry'. It can be used to express sadness, emotional distress, or strong feelings. In different conjugations, it appears as 'nutan' (I cry), 'nutab' (he/she/it cries), 'nutame' (we cry), etc. This verb is commonly used when describing emotional responses like crying due to sadness, pain, or overwhelming emotions.
